Checkpoint Caribbean LTD (Checkpoint)  is located in the Sabanetas Industrial Park, Lot 28, Street #1, Ponce, Puerto Rico.

It is the Checkpoint policy to conduct the Manufacturing program in such a way that accidents that could cause chemical emissions to the environment are prevented. This policy is outlined in the "Standard Operations Procedures (SOP's) and the Employee Training Program. Nevertheless, equipment and safety measures are taken to handle an emergency in case one happens.

The Checkpoint facility in Ponce handles toxic chemicals. Among them there is "Chlorine" CAS 7782-50-5, "Hydrochloric Acid" CAS 7647-01-0, "Phosphoric Acid" CAS 7664-38-2 and "Methyl Ethyl Ketone" CAS 78-93-3. The Chlorine gas is used in quantities that exceed the limit requiring the preparation of a Risk Management Plan (RMP).

In general, the Checkpoint Plant plan to prevent accidents includes: dikes with capacity to contain a spill from each and every process tank with chemicals, closed rooms to store flammable liquids and scrubber systems to ventilate equipment and process storage tanks. Specifically, for the Chlorine gas there are two trains of scrubbers with Caustic Soda to neutralize any leaks or ventilate from the process. If there is a leak, the Chlorine gas will be detected by automatic electronic detectors, set point 1 ppm, strategically located in the Plant. The electronic sensors send an alarm to both the Chemical Plant control room and the Security Guard control room. In the case of a fire in the Press Room, where Metil Ethyl Ketone is handled Checkpoint has installed an automatic Carbon Dioxide fire control system. The fire control system is automatically activated by heat sensors.

Checkpoint has not registered an accident that causes a Chlorine leak to the environment in the last 5 years. More than that, the chemical plant started operations in March 1998 and in the history of those 10 years of operation there has been no accident that causes a Chlorine leak to the

environment.

Checkpoint has a written Emergency Response Plan and is an active member of the Ponce Region Local Emergency Planning Committee.

The Checkpoint plant is regularly inspected by the FM Global company to review the loss prevention measures against fire, natural disasters and accidents. Fron these inspections there are recommendations to improve the safety conditions in the plant.
